docs.summary: This is an Action SPI Provider that can be implemented by Application developers. An Action is a part of a Wix Automation.

relatedGuides.name: About the Action SPI Input Schema

params.name: actionKey
params.doc:
Action key as defined in your app's action configuration in the Wix Developers Center. 
For example, `send-email` or `generate-invoice`.

docs.summary:
This endpoint retrieves quota information for an action. 

Wix calls this endpoint when a site contributor opens the **Manage your automations quotas** modal 
in the **Automations** dashboard. The response from this endpoint is displayed in the modal. 
The data is displayed based on the response body format. Learn more about [quota display options](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-automations/action-provider-v1/displaying-action-quotas).

Implementing this endpoint is optional. To implement it, select the endpoint under **Action's SPI Endpoints** when editing your
action in the Wix Developers Center.

> **Notes:** 
> * Wix doesn't enforce action quota limits, it only displays them to the user.
> Enforcing quota limits is the action provider's responsibility.

examples.title: Get Quota Info sent by Wix

extra.description:
Get Quota Info request with a sample response body

curl -X POST https://provider.example.com/v1/quota-info \
-H 'user-agent: Wix' \
-H 'accept-encoding: gzip, deflate' \
-H 'content-type: text/plain; charset=utf-8' \
-d '{
          "actionKey": "email-client",
    }'

params.name: actionParams
params.doc:
Data for executing your action. 
Structured according to the [input schema](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-automations/action-provider-v1/about-the-action-spi-input-schema) 
you provided when configuring the action in the Wix Developer’s Center.

params.name: actionKey
params.doc:
Action key as defined in your app's action configuration in the Wix Developers Center. 
For example, `send-email` or `generate-invoice`.

docs.summary:
This endpoint is used to invoke an action provider's action.

Wix calls this endpoint when an automation using the provider's action is triggered. The request body includes
all the data needed to execute the action including the final values of any dynamic parameters.

There is no need to validate the data in the request body against the JSON schema defined when the action was configured.
Wix validates the data before calling this endpoint.

examples.title: Invoke sent by Wix

extra.description: Invoke request with a sample response body

params.name: actionKey
params.doc:
Action key as defined in your app's action configuration in the Wix Developers Center. 
For example, `send-email` or `generate-invoice`.

params.name: inputMapping
params.doc:
Stringified object representing the mapping a site contributor made between keys in the input schema and their expected 
values when running the automation. A field can be a static value mapping, or an expression that will be evaluated 
dynamically on each activation.

docs.summary:
This endpoint is used to validate the user's action configuration.

Wix calls this endpoint when a site contributor configures an automation with your action,
and when they select the automation from the **Your automations** list in the **Automations** dashboard. 
Wix uses the returned response to display an error message to a site contributor if the action is invalid.

Implementing this endpoint is optional. To implement it, select the endpoint under **Action's SPI Endpoints** when editing your
action in the Wix Developers Center. If you don't implement this endpoint, Wix assumes that the action is always valid.

As an example, a user configures an action called “Send gift card”, where a gift card is identified by a unique UUID.
After some period of time the user deletes the gift card, making the action’s mapping with the current
UUID invalid. Validate Configuration checks the validity of the action’s input values, and returns an error to the user 
if one or more of the values is not valid.

extra.description:
Validate Configuration request with a sample response body

curl -X POST https://provider.example.com/v1/validate-configuration \
-H 'user-agent: Wix' \
-H 'accept-encoding: gzip, deflate' \
-H 'content-type: text/plain; charset=utf-8' \
-d '{
          "actionKey": "email-client",
          "inputMapping": "{
                \"accountId\": \"some guid\",
        \"to\": \"some-email@example.com\",
        \"subject\": \"Welcome email\",
        \"body\": \"Hello there!\"
           }"
    }'

members.name: fieldKey
members.doc: Key corresponding to the field in the schema.

members.name: message
members.doc: Error message.

members.name: ctaLabel
members.doc: Label for a call-to-action button that's displayed with the error. Translated according to the SPI language context.

members.name: ctaUrl
members.doc: URL to redirect to when the call-to-action button is clicked.

members.name: title
members.doc: Title for the error.

members.name: enforced
members.doc:
Whether the quotas for your action are enforced. If you mark this as `true` in the response body,
 Wix displays the information in the quota object on the site dashboard. If you mark this as `false` for
 a user, Wix does not display any quota info on the site dashboard for your service.

members.name: quotaInfo
members.doc:
The plans your service provides, together with the quotas enforced by each plan. A site may be enrolled
in multiple plans. Plans and quotas can be related as follows:

+ A single plan has a single quota.
+ A single plan has multiple quotas.
+ Multiple plans are associated with multiple quotas.

Plans and quotas that are related should be grouped together in a single `quotaInfo`
object.

members.name: plans
members.doc: List of plans associated with the site making the request.

members.name: quotas
members.doc: List of quotas associated with the plans the site is enrolled in.

members.name: upgradeCta
members.doc:
Details for an upgrade call-to-action button.
 Displayed in the site contributor’s dashboard together with the quota details.

members.name: id
members.doc: Plan ID defined by the action provider.

members.name: name
members.doc: Plan name to display in the site contributor’s dashboard.

members.name: url
members.doc: CTA button redirect URL.

members.name: label
members.doc: CTA button label.

members.name: url
members.doc: Call-to-action redirect URL.

members.name: label
members.doc: Call-to-action label.

members.name: description
members.doc: Tooltip content.

members.name: cta
members.doc: Details for an options call-to-action link that appears in the tooltip.

members.name: featureName
members.doc: Name of the feature the quota is related to. For example, "Messages sent".

members.name: renewalDate
members.doc:
Quota renewal date in [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) format.
 For example, 10 July 2020 at 15:00 is written as `2020-07-10 15:00:00.000`.

members.name: currentUsage
members.doc: The user's current quota usage.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Quota limit data.

members.name: additionalInfo
members.doc: Additional information about the quota. Displayed as a tooltip in the site contributor’s dashboard.

members.name: actionKey
members.doc:
Action key as defined in your app's action configuration in the Wix Developers Center. 
For example, `send-email` or `generate-invoice`.

members.name: inputMapping
members.doc:
Stringified object representing the mapping a site contributor made between keys in the input schema and their expected 
values when running the automation. A field can be a static value mapping, or an expression that will be evaluated 
dynamically on each activation.

members.name: valid
members.doc: Whether the action configuration is valid.

members.name: configurationErrors
members.doc: Error details for an invalid action configuration. These are the errors displayed to the user.

members.name: actionKey
members.doc: Identifier for this action - human-readable action key - unique per app def ID

members.name: inputMapping
members.doc: Action input mapping to reset

members.name: actionKey
members.doc: Identifier for this action - human-readable action key - unique per app def ID

members.name: inputMappings
members.doc: Action input mappings to remove

members.name: actionKey
members.doc: Identifier for this action - human readable action key - unique per app def id

members.name: inputMappings
members.doc: list of action input mappings

messages.name: _com_wixpress_esb_spi_action_v1_GetDynamicInputSchemaRequest
messages.displayName: Get Dynamic Input Schema Request Object

members.name: actionKey
members.doc:
Action key as defined in your app's action configuration in the Wix Developers Center.
For example, `send-email` or `generate-invoice`.

members.name: inputMapping
members.doc:
Object representing the mapping a site contributor made between keys in the [input schema](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-automations/action-spi/about-the-action-spi-input-schema) and their expected
values when running the automation. A field can be a static value mapping, or an expression that will be evaluated
dynamically on each activation.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_esb_spi_action_v1_GetDynamicInputSchemaResponse
messages.displayName: Get Dynamic Input Schema Response Object

members.name: inputSchema
members.doc: A [JSON schema](https://json-schema.org/) containing the action's added dynamic fields and its static fields.

members.name: uiSchema
members.doc: A [UI schema](https://bo.wix.com/pages/automations-ui-lib/?path=/story/getting-started--about) is a JSON Schema that describes the UI of the static and dynamic fields.

members.name: actionParams
members.doc:
Data for executing your action. 
Structured according to the [input schema](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-automations/action-provider-v1/about-the-action-spi-input-schema) 
you provided when configuring the action in the Wix Developer’s Center.

members.name: actionKey
members.doc:
Action key as defined in your app's action configuration in the Wix Developers Center. 
For example, `send-email` or `generate-invoice`.

members.name: result
members.doc:
If the action has no output schema, return an empty object.
If the action defines an output schema, return a JSON object that correlates to the output schema.
